page.title: 17HIGHBRIDGE DOCKS THEN
page.content:
HIGHBRIDGE DOCKS-then
Highbbidge Docks were built in 1854 in connection with the SOMERSET & DORSET RAILWAY,to provide a port on the BRISTOL CHANNEL for import & exports.The main river Clyce was diverted through the New Cut(see P.15)and the old course was developed into the dock.Timber,coal,livestock & general cargo were the major goods.The S & D Rly. owned 3 boats whose main function was to ply between the docks & S.Wales carring coal for the Railway,as its main repair & maintainence depot was at Highbridge.The end came when the railway closed its works in the 1930's.Even then the docks staggered on until the 1960's when it was abandoned.(see P.18)
